examples.text: The country's economy is now in grave peril.
The heroine finds herself **in mortal peril**.
She seemed blissfully unaware of the peril she was in.
They warned that his life was in imminent peril.
We face the immediate peril of being bought out by another company.

definitions.definition: the fact of something being dangerous or harmful

examples.text: She gave a warning about the perils of drug abuse.
a campaign illustrating the perils of drug abuse
the great perils facing the environment
the perils posed by global warming

definitions.definition: used to warn somebody that if they do something, it may be dangerous or cause them problems

examples.text: Teachers ignore the importance of these results at their peril.
Ignore these warnings at your peril.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin peric(u)lum ‘danger’, from the base of experiri ‘to try’.
